title: Part A
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not include both of the following.

· A description that cells divide by mitosis when the organism is growing or repairing tissues

· An explanation that spindle fibers attach to the center of each duplicated chromosome and assist in pulling one chromatid to each pole of the cells so that, when the cell divides, each daughter cells contains a copy of each chromosome
The response includes only one of the following.

The response includes both of the following.

· A description that cells divide by mitosis when the organism is growing or repairing tissues

· An explanation that spindle fibers attach to the center of each duplicated chromosome and assist in pulling one chromatid to each pole of the cells so that, when the cell divides, each daughter cells contains a copy of each chromosome

title: Part B
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:

title: Part D
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not include the prediction that the cell will be unable to undergo mitosis.
The response includes the prediction that the cell will be unable to undergo mitosis.
